intro: Gilia wilcoxii, commonly known as the Wilcox's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Gilia wilcoxii is an important plant for pollinators and is considered a species of conservation concern in some areas.
